EN_transcript: At another time he devoted himself entirely to music, and in a long latticed room, with a vermilionandgold ceiling and walls of olivegreen lacquer, he used to give curious concerts, in which mad gypsies tore wild music from little zithers, or grave yellowshawled Tunisians plucked at the strained strings of mon strous lutes, while grinning negroes beat monotonously upon copper drums, and, crouching upon scarlet mats, slim turbaned Indians blew through long pipes of reed or brass, and charmed, or feigned to charm, great hooded snakes and horrible horned adders.
